p:
In cases in which the current system of a regulatory authority is still on the path to maturity, and in which resources for dedicated expedited pathways are limited, regulators can adopt reliance or work-sharing approaches that help facilitate the application of such approaches. For example, regulators can rely on trusted regulatory authorities according to the WHO-Listed Authority Interim List of National Regulatory Authorities.
56 They can also depend on available global pathways and guidance through the WHO Emergency Use Listing or Prequalification program.
4
,
57
